trans-unit.source: Retrieves the results of an overlapped operation

target.mrk: Retrieves the results of an overlapped operation

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Handle to the file, named pipe, or communications device. This is the same handle that was

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the file, named pipe, or communications device.
This is the same handle that was

target.mrk: Handle to the file, named pipe, or communications device.
This is the same handle that was

trans-unit.source: specified when the overlapped operation was started by a call to ReadFile, WriteFile, ConnectNamedPipe,

seg-source.mrk: specified when the overlapped operation was started by a call to ReadFile, WriteFile, ConnectNamedPipe,

target.mrk: specified when the overlapped operation was started by a call to ReadFile, WriteFile, ConnectNamedPipe,

trans-unit.source: TransactNamedPipe, DeviceIoControl, or WaitCommEvent.

seg-source.mrk: TransactNamedPipe, DeviceIoControl, or WaitCommEvent.

target.mrk: TransactNamedPipe, DeviceIoControl, or WaitCommEvent.

trans-unit.source: A $tagOVERLAPPED structure or a pointer to it that was specified when the overlapped operation was

seg-source.mrk: A $tagOVERLAPPED structure or a pointer to it that was specified when the overlapped operation was

target.mrk: A $tagOVERLAPPED structure or a pointer to it that was specified when the overlapped operation was

trans-unit.source: started.

seg-source.mrk: started.

target.mrk: started.

trans-unit.source: The number of bytes that were actually transferred by a read or write operation.

seg-source.mrk: The number of bytes that were actually transferred by a read or write operation.

target.mrk: The number of bytes that were actually transferred by a read or write operation.

trans-unit.source: For a TransactNamedPipe operation, this is the number of bytes that were read from the pipe.

seg-source.mrk: For a TransactNamedPipe operation, this is the number of bytes that were read from the pipe.

target.mrk: For a TransactNamedPipe operation, this is the number of bytes that were read from the pipe.

trans-unit.source: For a DeviceIoControl operation this is the number of bytes of output data returned by the device driver.

seg-source.mrk: For a DeviceIoControl operation this is the number of bytes of output data returned by the device driver.

target.mrk: For a DeviceIoControl operation this is the number of bytes of output data returned by the device driver.

trans-unit.source: For a ConnectNamedPipe or WaitCommEvent operation, this value is undefined.

seg-source.mrk: For a ConnectNamedPipe or WaitCommEvent operation, this value is undefined.

target.mrk: For a ConnectNamedPipe or WaitCommEvent operation, this value is undefined.

trans-unit.source: [optional] If True, the function does not return until the operation has been completed.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
If True, the function does not return until the operation has been completed.

target.mrk: [optional]
If True, the function does not return until the operation has been completed.

trans-unit.source: If False and the operation is still pending, the function returns False and the GetLastError function will return ERROR_IO_INCOMPLETE.

seg-source.mrk: If False and the operation is still pending, the function returns False and the GetLastError function will return ERROR_IO_INCOMPLETE.

target.mrk: If False and the operation is still pending, the function returns False and the GetLastError function will return ERROR_IO_INCOMPLETE.

trans-unit.source: True

seg-source.mrk: True

target.mrk: True

trans-unit.source: False, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information
